meanings.definition: The quality or state of being somewhat square in shape.
meanings.sent1: The squarishness of the table made it fit perfectly in the corner.
meanings.sent2: I noticed the squarishness of the building's design as I walked by.
meanings.sent3: The squarishness of the cake made it look like a giant brownie.
meanings.sent4: Her face had a certain squarishness to it, giving her a unique look.
meanings.sent5: The squarishness of the puzzle piece helped me find where it belonged quickly.

meanings.definition: A tendency or characteristic of being somewhat square in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The toy's squarishness made it easy for the toddler to grasp.
meanings.sent2: I admired the squarishness of the old-fashioned television set.
meanings.sent3: The squarishness of his dance moves added a comical touch to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The squarishness of the garden plot reminded me of a neatly arranged chessboard.
meanings.sent5: The squarishness of the box made it stand out among the other packages.
